intro: Thamnea hirtella, commonly known as the hairy thamnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Thamnea hirtella is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
